etymology.description: 亼(亼) (jí, "gather") over 皀(𠊊, "bowl of rice on a stand") = depicts a mouth over a bowl of rice
etymology.interpretation: The character visually represents the concept of eating, with a mouth positioned over a bowl of rice, symbolizing the action of consuming food.

parts.english: bowl of rice on a stand

examples.chinese: 春天到来时(春天到來時)，我们在露天餐厅飠火锅(我們在露天餐廳飠火鍋)。
examples.pinyin: Chūntiān dào lái shí, wǒmen zài lùtiān cāntīng shí huǒguō.
examples.english: When spring comes, we eat hot pot at the open-air restaurant.

examples.chinese: 他飠完午餐后(他飠完午餐後)，便去图书馆(便去圖書館)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shí wán wǔcān hòu, biàn qù túshūguǎn.
examples.english: After he finished eating lunch, he went to the library.
